summary:
The Prodigy is an English electronic dance music band formed in 1990 by Liam Howlett. They are known for their high-energy "big beat" sound and influential role in the rave scene. The original lineup included charismatic frontman Keith Flint and dancers Leeroy Thornhill and Sharky. 

Their albums "Music for the Jilted Generation" and "The Fat of the Land" were huge successes, featuring hits like "Firestarter" and "Breathe." Despite lineup changes and Flint's passing in 2019, The Prodigy remains one of the best-selling electronic acts ever, winning numerous awards and influencing generations of musicians.
title: The Prodigy
